image.altText: A man holding a cricket shirt in front of a beach.

props.synopsis: They travelled on horse and cart and were smuggled on a boat for three months to England, the story of the First XI Aboriginal cricket team is being remembered as a descendant presents the Boxing Day medal.

title.children: 'They were a band of brothers': The largely untold story of Australia's first touring cricket team

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking in an interview in a concerned manner

props.synopsis: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

title.children: SA Labor stalwart and former federal minister Nick Bolkus dies

image.altText: Peter Drew pastes up a poster

props.synopsis: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

title.children: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti

image.altText: Dairy cows stand behind a fence.

props.synopsis: New technology allowing livestock to be remotely moved via electronic collars has been legalised in SA. Industry says virtual fencing has the potential to save animals and even human lives.

title.children: Emerging virtual fencing tech could help save cattle trapped in bushfires

image.altText: A Santa Claus sitting on a throne surrounded by presents at kids festival

props.synopsis: South Australia's Christmas traditions have evolved from the days of John Martin's Magic Cave. So, can the state lay claim to being the most festive in Australia?

title.children: Is South Australia the most festive state?

image.altText: A women holds up four different types of frozen prawns in bags

props.synopsis: New research shows younger Aussies prefer to save time and mess by buying pre-peeled prawns over the festive season.

title.children: Peeled or whole? How we buy prawns reveals a growing generational divide

image.altText: Woman wearing colouful top and apron stands smiling in her kitchen with cakes wrapped in colourful paper on bench next to her

props.synopsis: As households across the world sit down to enjoy a festive feast, Faye Taylor revels in knowing 500 of her traditional Christmas cakes are bringing enjoyment and helping raise funds for people in need.

title.children: Faye's great Christmas cake baking mission

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression and black hair takes a selfie

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

title.children: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail

image.altText: An opened box of silver tube-like detonators on top of a red file on the table

props.synopsis: A man has been charged after police allegedly seized explosive detonators and three unregistered firearms among other weapons from his property in Adelaide's north.

title.children: Weapons, detonators allegedly found in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A man applies a paperbark splint to a woman's ankle

props.synopsis: With no mobile phone coverage and no chance of anyone hearing her call out, Margie Moroney decided to crawl back to the campsite she was sharing with her colleagues.

title.children: Woman survives 500-metre crawl with broken ankle in remote Arnhem Land

image.altText: A crashed up motorcycle surrounded by police, traffic cones and paramedics as well as a yellow tarpaulin

props.synopsis: The men, both in their 60s, crashed at the intersection of Main South Road and Sunvalley Road in O'Halloran Hill on Tuesday.

title.children: Two killed in crash between car and motorcycle in Adelaide's south

image.altText: A woman and a black labrador dog stand in front of a vast outback landscape

props.synopsis: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

title.children: Seeing eye dog Mika is helping station owner navigate life on the land

image.altText: A smiling woman sitting at a desk.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

title.children: Woman accused of trying to kill ex allegedly searched for 'hit men'

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles outside his house which is swamped by Christmas lights

props.synopsis: Families from all over Adelaide visit Joe Ferraro's home to marvel at his Christmas display, which he has amassed a collection of more than 50,000 lights since he began nearly 20 years ago.

title.children: The Christmas display that charms kids, adults and nuns visiting on a minibus

image.altText: A red sign that says "sale" in white writing is placed on a display rack of shoes.

props.synopsis: Boxing Day spending is expected to hit a record high, supported by revived household spending after three interest rate cuts.

title.children: Australians tipped to spend record $1.6b on Boxing Day sales

image.altText: A collection of credit cards.

props.synopsis: Cashless payments make up about three-quarters of all transactions in Australia but come at a cost to both merchants and consumers, leaving some asking if it is time to consider it essential infrastructure.

title.children: What are you really paying when using a card this Christmas?

image.altText: A man in a beekeeping suit holds a hive frame which is covered in bees

props.synopsis: The varroa mite may be tiny — only a millimetre or two long — but it poses a huge threat to honey bees, beekeepers and honey producers, who are on high alert after the destructive mite's recent arrival in South Australia.

title.children: Tiny, destructive varroa mite has SA beekeepers on high alert

image.altText: A house with damage to its front entrance with a black Mercedes-Benz car parked in the front yard

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier man is sentenced after hiring a crane and partially destroying another man's home.

title.children: Man who hired crane to attack another man's home gets home detention

image.altText: A woman sitting on a fence

props.synopsis: For decades, pregnancy was seen as an "injury" that could end a career. But now, determination and growing industry support are seeing marathon-running mothers reach new heights after giving birth.

title.children: For these elite runners, pregnancy was once 'treated as an injury'

image.altText: A sign with blue text that says Bedford.

props.synopsis: Creditors have voted to support the sale of Bedford to NDIS provider The Disability Trust, which would guarantee the jobs of 1,100 workers.

title.children: Creditors vote in favor to sell Bedford to NDIS disability provider

image.altText: Police in Bondi after terrorist attack.

props.synopsis: The NSW Police Commissioner, Mal Lanyon, has activated new powers prescribed under changes to NSW protest laws sparked by the terrorist attack at Bondi Beach on December 14.

title.children: Public assemblies banned for 14 days across Sydney as police enact new laws

image.altText: Pope Leo stands on a balcony flanked by two cardinals.

props.synopsis: During his Urbi et Orbi (city and world) speech on Christmas Day, Pope Leo XIV has called for an end to all wars and for people to think about the conditions in Gaza.

title.children: Pope Leo asks people to think about Gaza during Christmas Day speech

image.altText: crane collapse

props.synopsis: Storms hit south-east Queensland on Christmas Day afternoon, knocking out power to thousands of homes.

title.children: Crane collapses, thousands in south-east Qld lose power on Christmas Day

image.altText: A timelapse of the Adélie penguin colony in East Antarctica.

props.synopsis: Preparations are underway for the arrival of the deadly H5 strain of bird flu in the Australian Antarctic Territory, as scientists gather baseline population data so they can measure potential deaths among wildlife.

title.children: Scientists on 'high alert' as bird flu threat looms over Australian Antarctic Territory

image.altText: Three phones showing social media posts from Tropical Cyclone Alfred with weather map of the storm behind it

props.synopsis: State government reports have found that while social media plays a vital role in warning communities during tropical cyclones, some posts can lack context and spread misinformation.

title.children: Social media can help save lives during cyclones, but also spread false rumours

image.altText: A woman wearing a red dress sits at a grand piano on a stage which is in silhouette. Chandeliers hang behind her

props.synopsis: From homegrown heroes to visiting legends, here are Australia's favourite classical music and jazz stories this year.

title.children: Virtuosos to video games: The top classical music and jazz stories of 2025

image.altText: A young Kamahl fronting his television show with the ABC orchestra

props.synopsis: At 91, Malaysian-born Australian entertainment legend Kamahl reflects on his life and career.

title.children: Kamahl reflects on his life and career

image.altText: A black and white portrait of Edward VIII while he was Prince of Wales.

props.synopsis: Before Harry fled the Royals for Meghan and Montecito, this would-be King of England was famous for trading his title for love. And the cracks began to show on a trip to Australia.

title.children: Before Harry fled the royals there was Edward, who traded his title for love

image.altText: Spongebob and Patrick stand on the front of a pirate ship.

props.synopsis: The soaring mercury has you craving the cool, dark sanctuary of the cinema. But what to see? The art-house awards-season hopeful? The psychological book adaptation? The one with the big snake?

title.children: From Spongebob to Orwell: Your guide to Boxing Day movies

image.altText: GettyImages-96357914

props.synopsis: It was the deal that changed the face of baseball for good, and set in motion the most infamous sporting curse of all.

title.children: The Boxing Day deal that set in motion sport's most infamous curse

image.altText: A US military helicopter flying over a large oil tanker at sea.

props.synopsis: The White House has ordered US military forces to focus almost exclusively on enforcing the "quarantine" of Venezuelan oil, a US official says.

title.children: White House official says US forces to focus on 'quarantine' of Venezuela

image.altText: Image of a young woman leaning on her arms on a white picket fence. In the background, a green oval and cricket players.

props.synopsis: More women of all ages are signing up to play cricket in regional Victoria.

title.children: Regional Victorian cricket clubs are batting above average for female participation

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein stand on a beach.

props.synopsis: The Department of Justice says the release of the Epstein files will take "a few more weeks" after a million additional documents were uncovered.

title.children: A million more Epstein files found, US government says

image.altText: Erin Rolandsen and her husband, both wearing sunglasses, take a smiling selfie in front of a city skyline.

props.synopsis: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

title.children: This couple is on opposite sides of the political divide. Here's how they make it work

image.altText: A vehicle with a Happy Chanukah! sign that has sustained fire damage.

props.synopsis: Authorities were called to a St Kilda East residence about 3am, where a car with a sign celebrating the Jewish holiday had been set alight.

title.children: PM, Jewish leaders condemn apparent firebombing of Hanukkah car
